name: Shepperton Studios
description: A renowned British film studio complex with a rich history of major film productions.

content.title: Overview
content.body: Shepperton Studios is a historic film studio complex located in Surrey, England. It serves as one of the major film production facilities in the UK, known for its diverse stages, backlots, and post-production services. The studio is used for the production of TV shows, films, and commercials.

content.title: Film History
content.body:
**Notable Productions:**
- *Alien* (1979): Many interior scenes were shot at Shepperton Studios.
- *2001: A Space Odyssey* (1968): Key segments of Stanley Kubrick's epic were filmed here.
- *The Rocky Horror Picture Show* (1975): Shepperton was pivotal for this cult classic.
- *Gladiator* (2000): Several sequences from this Oscar-winning film were filmed at the studio.
- *Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban* (2004): Parts of the third installment were shot here.

These films represent just a handful of the vast and varied projects Shepperton Studios has been involved with over the years.

content.title: Visiting
content.body: Shepperton Studios is primarily a working studio and is not regularly open to the public for tours. However, certain events and special industry-related tours might be available upon arrangement. It remains a fully active production site and continues to contribute to many ongoing film and television projects.
